result.text:
It's never too late to know the Truth, a 2013 documentary about Xizang. 

Aside from a powerful through-out narratage focusing on the region's subnational relations with the Center over the past centuries, US policy shift from 42'47'' would tell how shameless it has attempted to undermine China's sovereignty via Xizang. 

Anglo-Saxons forget one thing however: though China suffered from a century-long humiliation until 1949, its resolve to safeguard its territorial integrity and national dignity has never been swayed. China is fully confident in its capability of governing and commitment to defending its core interest!

Further, Xizang has seen even more tremendous changes for the better since 2013, including for example extreme poverty removed, bullet train put into service, electricity supply by national grid and e-commerce booming etc. So Chris Nebe can shoot new episodes for his Tibet (Xizang) - the Truth.
 #LearnfromXizangifyouwishtobestrong
 https://t.co/pC6PgYl6fK via @YouTube

result.text:
For two large countries like China and the U.S., turning their back on each other is not an option. It is unrealistic for one side to remodel the other. And conflict and confrontation between them has unbearable consequences for both sides.

Major-country competition is not the prevailing trend of current times and cannot solve the problems facing China and the U.S. or the world at large. Planet Earth is big enough for the two countries to succeed, and one country’s success is an opportunity for the other.

result.text:
张云：白皮书对颠倒黑白者发出最强音
The Practice and Historical Achievements of the CPC Strategy of Governing Xizang in the New Era voices the strongest Refutation to those who intentionally and chronically turn black white.
Video in Chinese @Echinanews 
#LearnfromXizangifyouwishtobestrong #Leadership #Governance

Zhangyun, a top Tibetology expert from China said, Many Western media, including politicians, have been to Xizang and understand the real Xizang, but many people allow lies to spread around the world. For example, Nancy Pelosi has also been there, but still she lied after going back, because this is who she is, that is, they do not want to wish China any good, do not want to spread facts. The white paper, I think, clarifies right and wrong very well, and turns many of these wrongs right .

Read his remarks in Chinese here: https://t.co/bSYzqiLolE

郑堆：西藏驶入高质量发展的快车道
Zhengdui: Xizang has embarked on a fast track of high-quality development

"如今，西藏经济发展已经实现了从“跟跑”到“并跑”，和全国各省份站在了同一起跑线上，发展基础之实前所未有、发展机遇之好前所未有、发展后劲之足前所未有"。
At present, Xizang's economic development has realized the transformation from "running after" to "running together", standing at the same starting line as other provinces in the country, and the foundation for development is unprecedented, the development opportunity is unprecedented, and the development momentum is unprecedented.

Who else in the world can make the same announcement with respect to minority development within their border? #learnfromXizangifyouwishtobestrong #leadership #governance

https://t.co/6Q4ZY4ckg5

result.text:
雅鲁藏布大峡谷深处的工布新年
@XHNews via @PDChina
#LearnfromXizangifyouwishtobestrong

November 14 is the first day of October in Tibetan calendar, and it is also the Gongbu New Year in Nyingchi City, Xizang. The family of Tsering Dhondup, 40, and Laba Zhuoma, 38, live in Sosong Village, located at the foot of the Namjbarwa Peak in the Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon in Myrin, Nyingchi City. 

They started their hostel in 2013, and now their hostel has more than 50 rooms and brings in over ¥1 mln a year. The family is rich, life is getting better and better, the traditional Gongbu New Year is still the most important festival in the family full of rituals.

11月14日是藏历的十月初一，也是西藏林芝市的工布新年。林芝市米林市派镇索松村位于雅鲁藏布大峡谷中的南迦巴瓦峰脚下，40岁的次仁顿珠和38岁的拉巴卓玛一家住在这里。他们从2013年就开办民宿，如今他们的民宿有50多个房间，每年可以带来100多万元的收入。家庭富裕了，生活越来越好，传统的工布新年仍然是家里最重要的节日，过年的日子仪式感满满。
Read for more👇(in Chinese):
https://t.co/OL4NAoW3rA

result.text:
四季牧歌：鄂尔多斯草原上的“秋日牧歌”
via @PDChina 

金秋时节，天气转凉，鄂尔多斯草原上一片金黄。牧民道尔吉骑着摩托车在草原上驱赶马群，开始忙碌的一天。饮马、赶羊是这个季节每天的工作。

道尔吉住在内蒙古自治区鄂尔多斯市鄂托克旗，今年61岁的他养了不少牲畜，其中有200多只经济效益较好的阿尔巴斯绒山羊。道尔吉望着自家膘肥体壮的牛羊，喜形于色。

牧忙喂牛羊，闲时抚琴瑟。秋忙之余，道尔吉与父亲明安宝会参加当地一项特色文艺活动——“乃日”。“乃日”可译为“礼乐”“娱乐”“聚会”，起源于元代，是一种以乐器歌舞为主的综合性民间表演艺术，被列入内蒙古自治区级非物质文化遗产名录。

道尔吉的父亲明安宝已经91岁，曾经是当地的乡村医生、乡镇卫生院院长。2018年，明安宝组织周边老人一同组建了老年人“乃日”乐队，他们定期排练并参加各项演出活动，在传承“乃日”文化的同时，也丰富了牧区老年人的精神文化生活。明安宝说：“自从有了这个乐队，我们有空就一起练习，比原来打麻将有意思多了。我以前通过看病治愈人们的身体，现在我们一起用‘乃日’文化‘治愈’大家的精神生活。”

收获的季节里，道尔吉父子俩把朋友叫到家中，用美食和音乐一同庆祝秋收的喜悦。鄂尔多斯草原上，三弦、四胡、笛子、扬琴齐声奏响，牧民载歌载舞，共庆丰收，一首欢乐的“秋日牧歌”在此奏响。

legacy.description: 24 Yrs in China since 1999 | Subscribe to my https://t.co/HAdQ4TimEO | Non Resident Senior Fellow, CCG Beijing | CCTV documentary host | Author
legacy.name: Mario Cavolo

result.text:
As expected, hopes are high and expectations low on the occasion of Chinese President Xi Jinping’s first visit to meet U.S. President Joe Biden at the annual APEC Summit being hosted by the famous city of San Francisco this month.

"Slandering, demonizing, and ostracizing China has never been the consensus of the United States, and in fact, many areas of American society depend on a stable and healthy U.S.-China relationship," said Lora Lumpe, head of the Quincy Institute, a Washington-based think tank that drafted an open letter signed and delivered by 34 organizations, including U.S. agricultural, industrial, educational, academic, and community groups, calling on the U.S. and Chinese heads of state to get serious about the challenges and use the meeting opportunity wisely.

The fact is that Asia Pacific region’s contribution to global stability & growth is enormous, and that accomplishment is without question, led by China’s economic resiliency and reach across the globe in a variety of industrial sectors and areas of trade between over 150 countries. 

While IMF expectations for China’s GDP growth remain an encouraging percentage at over 5% for the foreseeable future, the same can’t be said for the United States, the other critical economy in the world to help insure global economic and geopolitical stability. 

There is a further complication in the U.S.; with the arrival of the Presidential election year cycle, there is a high expectation that stronger, nastier negative propaganda vilifying China will be a core talking point coming from virtually all presidential election candidates whether Democrat or Republican.

“Asia Pacific region to continue to play an engine role and lead world economic growth. This is the fact. As a member of the Asia Pacific family, China has long attached importance to the role of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC), supported its development, and has always taken root in, built, and benefited the Asia Pacific. According to a report released by the Asian Development Bank, the economic recovery in the Asia Pacific region in the first half of this year was largely attributed to China, which contributed 64.2% to the region's economic growth.” Zhang Jie, a researcher at the Institute of Asia Pacific and Global Strategy at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences.

So one can easily understand the importance of Xi Jinping’s meeting with President Biden at this year’s APEC event. Confrontation and division and decoupling vs. unity and cooperation and development shouldn’t be a complicated choice.

The city itself as the host of the event took expected measures as any city would do to pretty up the streets in anticipation of the arrival of dozens of world leaders for the event. Unfortunately, those cleanup efforts, while welcome, also serve to shine a light on some of the U.S.’ most egregious and unaddressed societal problems including a severe homelessness and drug addiction crisis. 

In response to these news reports, many people both in and out of the United States are wondering why the U.S. politicians haven’t already made such efforts to provide a place for the homeless for the sake of the homeless themselves and the American people rather than just on the occasion of visiting world leaders who will be here and gone in just a few short days. Then what?

This issue leads us to consider a very important point in terms of how a country approaches its needs with regard to economic and societal development. Chinese citizens very much understand the opportunity created as a developmental catalyst when a city hosts large-scale international events. Such moments in time serve as a remarkable opportunity to muster the resources of the government and its citizens to create upgraded infrastructure, improve the city’s urban environment and create needed job opportunities. 

Such urban construction and enhancements serve the entire community permanently long after the big international event has ended. China has repeatedly used this strategy in many cities across China including Beijing for the Olympics, Shanghai for the World Expo, Hangzhou for the G20 and Asian Games, Chengdu for Universiade, Guangzhou for the Asian Games and frankly, many other such large venue events requiring urban infrastructure additions and upgrades.

President Xi goes into this meeting with some distinct advantages though western media reporting undoubtedly will not highlight such circumstances. For example, China is clearly standing in unison with the Arab countries against U.S. support of Israel’s recent brutal invasion and slaughtering of innocent children & women in Gaza. This action has caused the world to see Zionist Israel and its supporters as rejected, inhumane pariah, thus creating a further advantage for China’s rise to superpower for many decades in peace. 

China couldn’t ask for a better PR campaign showcasing its own rise to global superpower in peace for decades and this is a powerful message Xi can deliver and we will see how he does so in terms of nuance rather than in too divisive a manner. Xi also has the current advantage with respect to Taiwan, with the Taiwanese people seeing the Ukraine war and now the Israel-Hamas war clearly causing them to feel deep aversion to becoming the next dead casualties for the sake of U.S. strategic interests when they can easily see peaceful, stable relations between the island and mainland which includes over 45% of Taiwan exports heading to Hong Kong and the mainland.  Also, its easy to notice in the recent news cycle that the United States has failed in its efforts with respect to the chip wars against China and in its war against Russia in Ukraine, a veritable stalemate with over half a million dead for nothing. 

While on the surface, we will likely receive announcements that some obstacles have been removed, the overall tone from too many China hawks in the U.S. political sphere means the relationship will remain tense. As noted in a recent Sputnik News article, while “the talks are necessary and important for the normalization of bilateral relations and the maintenance of global stability.”, the root problem remains which is that China is roundly surpassing the United States in terms of economic growth and steadily increasing, peaceful relationships and economic development with well over 100 countries around the world outside of the G7 countries under the influence of the United States. 

These global developments are happening at an increasingly rapid pace through the other international platforms including BRICS, AIIB, RCEP, TPP and China’s own Belt & Road Initiative. China continues moving forward across the world in peace. That’s a problem for the United States. 

Mario Cavolo, Non Resident Senior Fellow, CCG

Posted at CounterPoint China substack, click here https://t.co/nnDlmfGoe8

#China #Xijinping #APEC2023 #Taiwan #Israel #Gaza #Biden #trade #war #peace #BRI #BRICS #RCEP #TPP #fentanyl #SanFrancisco #Homelessness
